post.body: Good sighting! I also much much much prefer the UK edition. The US version is endlessly annoying. Not sure why I ever watch.
Enjoy the new spatulas -- and merry Christmas!
Maybe this will help: http://tinyurl.com/79g2hd
I was going to follow up with another quiet little film tomorrow but I'd rather not sink myself into a full depression this week.
It sort of temporarily sunk me. But I watched an episode of Dogtown when I got home and felt better. That's the place you went, yeah?
I don't think I've wept during a movie quite that much in recent memory.
thinks the "chef" on this episode of Kitchen Nightmares has to be a hired actor. Nobody could care that little.
After cooking that many latkes, I'm over it. Putting together a burritoesque sort of thing for dinner.
stopped at two.
making three kinds of latkes for the weekend. Hopefully, they'll freeze up as well I think they will.
will listen to some Eartha Kitt tonight.
is not sure how her birth certificate got mixed in with that pile of stuff (in the back of a kitchen cabinet) but there it was.
has things to write, sweet potato latkes to make, knitting to do, and a pile of laundry. But first: coffee.
thought there was one chocolate pop left in the freezer. Alas, the box was empty. A sad moment.
will spend part of tomorrow taming her email inbox.
wants to know why China Fun raised their prices that much. It's decent but it's not great -- should be cheaper.
wishes the credit card points program iTunes gift cards would show up already. I'm in the mood for a music spending spree.
OK, new order -- Bloomingdale's (to spend gift card), movies, and back to JH for pho to go! Like, best day ever.
Rachel Getting Married it is (decided, totally, by the amount of time I'd have to spend walking in crap weather from subway to theatre).
Wendy & Lucy or Rachel Getting Married. Hmmm. Which brand of depressing flick to see... Or both! (But diff parts of town...hmmm.)
